intro: Rigiopappus leptocladus, commonly known as the slender-branching pappus, is a rare and specialized plant species found in specific alpine environments. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. The plant produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds enclosed in a pappus, which aids in its reproductive strategy in open, windy habitats. Its botanical features reflect adaptations to extreme environmental conditions, including frost resistance and efficient water conservation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological change.
